meanings.definition: The amount that a cage can hold.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper carried two cagefuls of bananas to feed the monkeys.
meanings.sent2: The pet store received a shipment of cagefuls of colorful birds.
meanings.sent3: The circus clown accidentally let a cagefuls of mice loose during the show!
meanings.sent4: The storage room was filled with cagefuls of memories waiting to be revisited.
meanings.sent5: The farmer collected cagefuls of eggs from the chicken coop every morning.

meanings.sent1: The animal shelter was full of cagefuls of barking dogs looking for homes.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper carefully cleaned the cagefuls of feathers left behind by the parrots.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of a cagefuls of surprises!
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a cagefuls of butterflies when she saw him.
meanings.sent5: The pet store displayed cagefuls of colorful fish swimming gracefully.
